definition: to blurt out without thinking (idiom)
powerful/vigorous/pungent/towards/in view of
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Catching Mom's hand in hand, I blurted out how sorry I was for that night.
sentences.chinese: 抓住媽媽的手，我衝口而出因爲那晚，我是多麼後悔。

sentences.english: He almost answered his own question, didn't he?
sentences.chinese: 他衝口而出，幾乎爲自己提供了答案。

sentences.english: I don't blame you for blurting it out.
sentences.chinese: 你那樣衝口而出，我不怪你。

definition: lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
to get straight to the point (idiom)
to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
to act stupid/to play dumb/to pretend to not know
wordless and silent (idiom); without speaking/taciturn
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
exactly what one wants
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
pleasing to the ear
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to talk back/to answer back
human face, beast's heart (idiom); two-faced/malicious and duplicitous
completely unreasonable
to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
